description: Warp anomaly definitions encountered during warp travel

visual.description: Common visual distortions within the warp tunnel

types.name: Chromatic Drift
types.description: The warp tunnel shifts through unexpected color bands, cycling from deep blue to amber before stabilizing.

types.name: Particle Bloom
types.description: Bright streaks of condensed particles race past the viewport, trailing luminous tails.

types.name: Field Stutter
types.description: The warp field flickers briefly, causing the tunnel walls to jitter before restabilizing.

types.name: Phantom Constellation
types.description: Points of light appear within the tunnel that resemble stars, but don't match any known chart.

types.name: Spatial Ripple
types.description: A visible ripple passes through the tunnel, distorting depth perception for a moment.

sensory.description: Uncommon anomalies that affect ship instruments or pilot perception

types.name: Navigational Drift
types.description: The ship's heading indicator spins erratically for several seconds before snapping back to true.

types.name: Comm Echo
types.description: A garbled fragment of a previous transmission replays on the comms channel, origin unknown.

types.name: Thermal Shadow
types.description: Heat sensors register a large object nearby, but visual and radar show nothing.

types.name: Chronometric Blip
types.description: The ship clock skips forward by a fraction of a second, then corrects. Logs show a gap.

shear.description: Rare disruptions to the warp field itself with tangible effects

types.name: Warp Shear
types.description: The tunnel briefly splits, revealing a sliver of realspace before the field seals. The ship shudders.

types.name: Mass Shadow
types.description: An invisible gravitational source warps the tunnel geometry, bending light around an unseen mass.

types.name: Phantom Lane
types.description: A second tunnel briefly appears alongside the current one, angling away into the unknown before fading.

legendary.description: Ultra-rare anomalies spoken of in pilot folklore, witnessed by very few

types.name: The Iris
types.description: A massive circular void opens ahead in the tunnel â€” a perfect dark circle ringed by distorted light. It passes over the ship harmlessly, but instruments spike across the board.

types.name: The Reflection
types.description: For a few seconds, an exact duplicate of your ship appears in the tunnel, flying in the opposite direction. Same hull. Same markings. Then it's gone.
